official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to award grants to improve childhood
			 care and education for local governments and local educational agencies.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subpart 1 of part D of title V of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:V/pt:D/spt:1

header.#text: Grants for improving early childhood care and education
Grants for improving early childhood care and education

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5415/ss:f

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and on such terms as such Secretaries set forth
			 in an interagency agreement, shall make competitive grants to qualified
			 entities for activities that build the capacity to develop, enhance, or
			 expand high-quality preschool programs, including comprehensive services
			 and family engagement, for preschool-aged children.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of
			 Health and Human Services

text.#text: From the amounts appropriated under

Each qualified entity that desires to receive a grant under this section shall submit an
			 application to the Secretaries at such time, in such manner, and
			 containing such information as the Secretaries may require.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for
			 technical assistance, evaluation, and other national activities related to
			 awarding grants under this section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5415/ss:f

text.#text: The Secretaries may use up to 3 percent of the funds appropriated under

header.#text: Technical assistance, evaluation, and other national activities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the activities carried out under this
			 section.

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days prior to the announcement of a competition under this section, the
			 Secretaries shall submit a report outlining the proposed competition and
			 priorities to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the activities carried out under this section,
			 including, at a minimum, information on the following:

text.#text: The Secretaries shall submit a report to

The progress of each qualified entity in moving toward fulfilling criteria outlined in the entity’s
			 application.

The extent to which the qualified entities used grants under this section to expand a high-quality
			 preschool program.

The costs and barriers to such expansion, including building and renovating preschool facilities so
			 that such facilities are high-quality and age and developmentally
			 appropriate.
In this section:

term.#tail:
means an early learning program that includes structural elements that are evidence-based and
			 nationally recognized (such as Head Start program performance standards or
			 research published by the National Institute for Early Education) as
			 important for ensuring program quality, including at a minimum:

text.#text: The term

High staff qualifications, including a teacher with a bachelor degree in early childhood education
			 or a bachelor degree in any field with a State-approved alternate pathway,
			 which may include coursework, clinical practice, and evidence of knowledge
			 of content and pedagogy relating to early childhood, and teaching
			 assistants with appropriate credentials.
High-quality professional development for all staff.
A staff-child ratio of no more than 1:10.
A class size of no more than 20.
A full-day program.
Full inclusion of children with disabilities.

Developmentally appropriate, evidence-based curricula and learning environments that are aligned
			 with the State early learning and development standards, for at least the
			 year prior to kindergarten entry.

Individualized accommodations and supports so that all children can access and participate fully in
			 learning activities.
Instructional staff salaries comparable to kindergarten through grade 12 teaching staff.
Program evaluation to ensure continuous improvement.
Onsite or accessible comprehensive services for children.
Evidence-based health and safety standards.

term.#tail: means a local educational agency or a local government entity.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There are authorized to be appropriated

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: such sums as may be necessary

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#tail:
for
			 each of the fiscal years 2015 through 2024
